line_1: My friendly grasp why eager to elude?
line_2: And fear'd to hurt thee by a touch too rude.

line_1: She seeks the cause, th'effect would fain elude,
line_2: By Death's o'erstretching stride too close pursu'd,

line_1: Or mingled humours, terse and new, elude
line_2: Distinctions nice, when grave or comic mood,

line_1: The cause, tho' worth the search, may yet elude
In hopes his terror to elude,
line_2: By day he mingles with the croud;
